definition: To examine a fire area to obtain information about current and probable fire behavior and other related fire suppression information.
label: Reconnaissance

definition: A fire that is intentional and wrongfully set to burn one's own or someone else's property.
label: arson fire

definition: The barometric pressure reading used to adjust a pressure altimeter for variations in existing atmospheric pressure or to the standard altimeter setting (29.92) inches.
label: altimeter setting

definition: Resources, together with a complement of overhead personnel, calculated to be sufficient to provide fire efficient incident management.
label: incident organization

definition: A surface active agent; any wetting agent. A formulation which, when added to water in proper amounts, will materially reduce the surface tension of the water and increase penetration and spreading abilities of the water.
label: surfactant

definition: A proportioning method or device that readily adjusts to changes in water flow and or pressure to maintain a desired mix ratio.
label: automatically regulated

definition: A group of indicators in a close proximity, of the same or different categories, that exhibit consistent directional values.
label: pattern clusters

definition: Fire that consumes the organic material beneath the surface litter ground, such as a peat fire.
label: ground fire

definition: Agencies and bureaus may have their own SOR for their data. An ISORs are identified by an interagency business area as the official application source of interagency data. An ISOR is the source that resolves duplicate records that may arise from various IADSs and ensures the data meets defined quality standards before it is included in official historical data sets. An ISOR can be an external source of data used by wildland fire.
label: Interagency System of Record

definition: Amount of fire prevention and fire suppression supplied; may be expressed several ways (e.g., percent of people or buildings protected, area protected, dollar value of property protected, firefighters per capita, water flow capability).
label: level of service

definition: The smaller area within the general origin area where the fire's direction of spread was first influenced by fuel, weather, and/or topography.
label: Specific Origin Area
definition extension: Generally this area is characterized by subtle and microscale fire pattern indicators as a result of less intense burning associated with the initial stages of the fire.

definition: Objects displaying more stain deposits on the exposed surface of the object than on the protected surface of the object indicating the direction of fire progression at that location. One of the 11 NWCG categories of fire pattern indicators.
label: fire pattern indicator, staining

definition: A fire department of which some or all members are unpaid.
label: Volunteer Fire Department

definition: A principal low cloud type in the form of individual cauliflower-like cells of sharp non-fibrous outline and less vertical development than cumulonimbus.
label: cumulus

definition: Localized storm characterized by one or more electrical discharge(s).
label: thunderstorm

definition: Within designated blocks of land, planning the locations of firelines, fire camps, water sources, and helispots; planning transportation systems, probable rates of travel, and constraints of travel on various types of attack units; and determining what types of attack units likely would be needed to construct particular firelines, their probable rate of fireline construction, and topographic constraints on fireline construction.
label: preattack planning

definition: The physical location of a resource when not on assignment.
label: home location

definition: In NFDRS, one of four classifications of general climate of an area.
label: climate class
definition extension: Part of the National Fire Danger Rating System (NFDRS).

definition: Fire hose having two cotton or other fiber jackets outside the rubber lining or tubing.
label: double jacket hose

definition: Documented, satisfactory performance in a specified position needed to qualify for another (usually higher level) position. Required experience cannot be challenged.
label: required experience

definition: A number related to the expected number of cloud-to-ground lightning strokes to which a protection unit is expected to be exposed during the rating period. The LR value used in the occurrence index includes an adjustment for lightning activity experienced during the previous day to account for possible holdover fires.
label: Lightning Risk
definition extension: Part of the National Fire Danger Rating System (NFDRS).

definition: Maximum external stress load (in pounds) with full fuel and pilot in calm air at standard atmospheric temperature.
label: external payload

definition: Gross vehicle weight (GVW) in excess of the gross vehicle weight rating (GVWR) specified by the chassis manufacturer. Also an excess of weight over the gross vehicle axle weight rating (GAWR) specified by the chassis manufacture.
label: overload (vehicle)

definition: Fire hose with a smooth inner coating of rubber or plastic to reduce friction loss.
label: lined fire hose

definition: A visible cluster of minute water/ice particles in the atmosphere.
label: cloud

definition: Heat transfer through a material from a region of higher temperature to a region of lower temperature.
label: conduction

definition: All structures built and used primarily for fire management, e.g. lookout towers, lookout cabins, telephone lines, and also firebreaks, fuel breaks, and roads to lookouts.
label: fire management improvements

definition: A permanent facility for the operation of helicopters which has been built to FAA standards and which is marked on aeronautical charts. Natural resource agencies refer to agency heliports as permanent helibases.
label: heliport

definition: The stratum containing the crowns of the tallest vegetation present (living or dead), usually above 20 feet.
label: canopy

definition: To review and compare outcomes with management and incident objectives desired for a wildland fire. One of the six component activities in an adaptive management process that may lead to adjusting future actions.
label: evaluate
